creditline: Gift of C. Lynn Seacord III and Catherine Master
description: colorful machine-like figure at upper portion against teal and magenta background; two colorful wheel-like forms; lower 3/4 of canvas is white with diagonal blue form and black dashed line giving shape to its upper half; "Dial Cross" at URC; "Grap" just below colors ULQ, with other letters and equation pieces throughout apparatus
image_copyright: © Estate of Karl Hagedorn %2F Bode Galerie %26 Edition%2C GmbH
signed: signed and dated in magenta paint URQ: K. Hagedorn 1970 | title ULC: Dial Cross
text: Dial Cross is a hybrid image in which the artist combined the human body and machines. They combine at the top into an unusual construction that is mechanical and organic, about to perform a mysterious function with the aid of the long lever that leads down to the lower right corner of the canvas. Hagedorn was a German émigré to the U.S. who settled initially in the Twin Cities where he taught, exhibited, and took commissions for stained glass.
title: Dial Cross
